data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face forward, then you don’t mind taking 10 steps backward and 10 steps forward. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You must take at least 4 steps in order to turn around. You can only take 10 steps to return to the starting point. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you took 7 steps and took 1 step, we know you went back to the beginning. There is a 4 on the directions given where the first 7 are taken. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Take 10 steps back to the starting point. Take 9 steps back to the starting point. Take 3 steps back to the starting point. Take a total of 9 + 3 = 19 steps back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you turn around, you are still on the road (you can take 7 steps backward on the way). Take and turn right. To return to the starting point, turn around and turn around in reverse again. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
It may take less total steps when you take a little less of a step in one direction than the other. All of the instructions have the right to turn to the right. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you aren’t returning to the starting point, your instructions do not follow. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
One of the rules of geometry is that you always go towards the left. This means that you go straight up to your starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You cannot turn around and walk back to the starting point at the same time. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To take 1 step back, always face forward until you get to the beginning point where you begin to take 3 steps forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can always do any step backward, but to return to the starting point, you must always face forward. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward, even if you're walking, these instructions should always lead you back to the starting point. If you are walking left, the first 3 steps are 1 step left. If you are walking right, the first 9 steps are 9 steps left. It can be inferred that with these instructions, you would never be back to the starting point. Therefore, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take 4 steps left, you take 4 steps forward, you take 3 steps forward and you take a step right. If you are facing right, you are facing left. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
It is not possible to go backward and forward at the same time. There are 4 directions. To take a step backward, you have to take 6 steps left. There is only one direction. Thus, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Turn right. Turn around. Turn left. Take 4 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 8 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right twice and take 8 steps to get to the starting point. Turn around 3 times and take 10 steps to get back to the starting point. Therefore, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 3 steps. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Turn around means return to the starting point. The starting point is the one that you left. Walking back, you start at the first place that you left at, ending up at the point where you left at. From there, you walk back to the starting point. To get back to the starting point of your original journey, the only way that you could go back is if you took a different sequence of steps. If you followed these instructions correctly, you can return to your starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

A person can either take 9 steps or take 9 steps. If one exits, one has to take 7 more steps to return to the starting point. If one turns right, one is going to return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 1 step. Take 2 steps. Take 9 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Turn around and take 1 step then take 1 step and then take 2 steps then take 6 steps then take 4 steps and then take 4 steps and then take 5. If you take 9 steps you go back to the beginning, if you take 7 steps you go back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The same person can return to a starting point the same number of different ways. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 1 step. Take 1 step. Take 3 steps. Turn left. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
As a starter, you should take 6 steps. Since you have 6 steps to take, the starting point is the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

Take 5 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 2 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

Turning around takes 10 steps. 3 steps is not enough to get back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 2 steps right. Take 5 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 7 steps forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The starting point is facing forward. You are taking 7 steps left. The right step is 2. You are taking 5 steps backward. In the first sentence you are facing left. The second sentence tells you to travel left. So, the answer is No.

Facing forward will always take you forward. When you take 7 steps backward, you are backwards in 3 feet. When you take 9 steps left, you are left in 9 feet. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you turn around the person you are returning to start from will not return you to the beginning. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps left. Take 6 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Forward facing always means putting one’s face upward. Walking 6 right steps leaves one with several blocks to your side. So, the answer is yes.

If you turn right and take 5 steps, you take 5 steps. You take 5 steps and turn around. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 2 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To return to the starting point, you must take at least 2 steps backward. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 4 steps. Take 1 step. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The starting point is the point where you begin in the first step. You can take one, four or 10 steps to get back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around is a statement that is repeated in both directions. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 10 steps right. Take 7 steps backward. Take 3 steps left. Take 8 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The first part is always facing forward. Since we always take 8 steps right, the next part is always facing the start. This pattern of moving forward and backward is called the “forward motion”. The starting point is the starting point of the previous direction. Thus, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Turn around. Turn around. Turn around. Take 1 step. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning around takes 7 steps back towards the starting point and goes one step further until you come back. Turning around again takes 7 steps back towards the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

You take 5 steps backwards to move forward once. You take 4 steps backwards to travel backward once. Take 9 steps forward and face forward to move forward once. Thus, the answer is no.

Every time you take a step, you are going back to that direction and can only do so many steps back in one direction. The instructions are meant to work like a game. So, the answer is No.

10 steps is. There are four directions of travel. Right turning is the straight line. Turn around is the turning around of the car. So, the answer is no.

If you always feildward face forward, your head would turn and you would be facing forward. If you feildright face forward, you would start your left foot forward with your left foot. If you feildright face backward, your head would turn and you would be facing backward. If you feildright face frontward, you would start your right foot forward with your right foot. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 4 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 5 steps left. Take 6 steps backward. Take 9 steps forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Taking a step backward is a forward action. All steps taken when facing forward are forward. Reversing a step is a backward action. So, the answer is No.

Take 2 steps forward. Take 9 steps forward. Take 3 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

In a forward motion, you have to take 9 steps forward and 3 steps backward. In a backward motion, you take 2 steps forward and 8 steps left. If you can follow these instructions correctly, you repeat the process 9 times, alternating between the right and the left directions. So, the answer is No.

Turn left for three steps and take 9 steps. Turn right for 3 steps and take 3 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you always face forward, after taking 9 steps, you take 9 steps. If you always face left instead of right, after taking 5 steps, you take 9 steps. If you always face forward, after taking 9 steps, you take 9 steps. So, the answer is Yes.
